solution_line_template: Ian is able to earn ${hourly_rate} per hour doing surveys. If he worked {hours_worked} hours doing surveys, then he earned ${hourly_rate}*{hours_worked} = $<<{hourly_rate}*{hours_worked}={total_earned}>>{total_earned}
If he spent half of what he earned, then he spent ${total_earned} * {spent_percentage_value}% = $<<{total_earned}*{spent_percentage_value}*{percent_conversion_factor}={money_spent}>>{money_spent}
If Ian spent ${money_spent} of his earnings, then he has ${total_earned} - ${money_spent} = $<<{money_left}={money_left}>>{money_left} left
